question: P and Q start at the same time in the same direction to run around a stadium. P completes a round in 252 seconds and Q in 198 seconds, both starting at the same point. After what time will they meet again at the starting point?
response:
To solve this problem, we need to find the time difference between P and Q. We can do this by subtracting the time taken by Q from the time taken by P.

P takes 252 seconds to complete a round, and Q takes 198 seconds to complete a round.

252 - 198 = 54 seconds

Now, we need to convert the time difference into minutes and hours.

54 seconds / 60 seconds per minute = 0.9333 minutes

0.9333 minutes / 60 minutes per hour = 0.1555 hours

Since the time difference is less than an hour, we can round it to the nearest hour.

0.1555 hours = 1 hour and 15 minutes

The answer is 1 hour and 15 minutes.
